channel.title: mxe.no · Mats Estensen
channel.description: Recent content on mxe.no · Mats Estensen

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: program helloworld print *, "Hello, World!" end program helloworld The snippet above is a simple implementation of a “Hello, World!”-program in Fortran. You can try to build and execute it online here! While Fortran may not be the most obvious language to use in 2018 it’s what I am currently working with in a project on numerical physics (where the language still proves superior). As this is the first post on this site in its current format, I’ll give a brief introduction to it.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Mats Estensen Hi! Welcome to my personal digital corner of the Internet! I am an IT Infrastructure Engineer and Consultant working in Oslo, Norway. Currently, I am on 4-month educational leave while I am pursuing a master’s thesis within physics and nanoelectronics. While I’m not busy working I enjoy going to concerts and listen to music, jumping out of perfectly good planes, and enjoying life – all while looking out for new things to learn.

item.title: Contact
item.description: For inquiries, contact me on: mail: matsest@mxe.no For increased security, encrypt your message by using my public PGP key or send from a Tutanota account for end-to-end encryption enabled by default. phone: +47 924 54 560 I recommend using an app like Signal or WhatsApp as they are more secure and reliable than SMS.
